Name: Insightful Revelation Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may perform an Insightful Revelation action and spend 2 Destiny points to make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b]. If he succeeds, he learns some valuable information that he did not previously possess pertaining to his current situation. What he learns is up to the GM. but it must be valuable to the player overcoming his immediate encounter or situation, and the information cannot be obtainable by any other immediately available means.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from skill check to activate Insightful Revelation.

Name: Add Boost
Description: Add [BO] to skill check to activate Insightful Revelation.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Insightful Revelation to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Additional Skills
Description: When making the Insightful Revelation action, the character may replace Knowledge (Education) with any other Knowledge skill.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: If the check is successful, the character may spend [TR] to gain one additional piece of equally useful information.

Name: Duration
Description: The character may perform the Insightful Revelation action one additional time per game session.

Name: Destiny
Description: Insightful Revelation costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Expertise Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session as an action, the character may spend two Destiny Points to reduce the difficulty of all career skill checks he makes by one to a minimum of Easy for the remainder of the encounter.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from career skill checks made while Unmatched Expertise is activated.

Name: Activation
Description: Activate Unmatched Expertise as a maneuver instead of as an action.

Name: Activation
Description: Activate Unmatched Expertise as an incidental that may be triggered out of turn instead of as an action.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of career skill checks by 2 instead of 1.

Name: Superior Reduction
Description: Once per session while Unmatched Expertise is activated, may reduce the difficulty of one non-career skill.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Expertise costs 1 Destiny Point to activate instead of 2.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: The difficulty of all career skill checks is reduced to a minimum of Simple instead of Easy.

Name: Last One Standing Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session during a combat encounter, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b]. If he succeeds, he skips his next turn and eliminates all enemy minions in the encounter. (The minions are all eliminated immediately, so will not get to participate further in the combat, but for the sake of the narrative, the PC can spend the next round of combat incapacitating them). The narrative means by which he accomplishes this is up to the player character, but should be suitably exciting, and must also be approved by the GM.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from skill check to activate Last One Standing.

Name: Add Boost
Description: Add [BO]to skill check to activate Last One Standing.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Last One Standing to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Increase Effect
Description: When triggering Last One Standing, eliminate one rival per increase effect upgrade in addition to the minions.

Name: Destiny
Description: Last One Standing costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Protection Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to gain the following ability: once per round, after suffering a hit and determining damage, the character may halve the damage (rounded up) dealt before it is applied to his soak. This ability is active for the remainder of the current round and two additional rounds.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Protection lasts for one additional round.

Name: Soak
Description: Gain +1 soak while Unmatched Protection is active.

Name: Protect Ally
Description: Once per session while Unmatched Protection is active, when an engaged ally is hit by an attack, may choose to be hit by that attack instead.

Name: Additional Reduction
Description: May reduce the damage of 1 additional hit suffered each round.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Protection costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Narrow Escape Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may spend two Destiny Points to make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Streetwise check[b]. If successful, the character is immediately able to flee from the current personal-scale combat encounter unscathed. The challenge is not overcome or defeated, but the character is able to evade the hazard or threat for the time being. The exact nature of what the character is trying to accomplish, as well as the end results, must be approved by the GM (see [B]Narrative Abilities[b] on page 38), but should be suitably creative or daring.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from the Skill check to activate Narrow Escape.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: Affect an additional number of allied characters equal to Cunning per Increase Effect upgrade purchased.

Name: Add Boost
Description: Add [BO] to the skill check to activate Narrow Escape.

Name: Change Scale
Description: Narrow Escape can be activated in a vehicle with the Piloting (Planetary) or Piloting (Space) skill.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Narrow Escape to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Change Skill
Description: Narrow Escape can be activated during social encounters with the Deception skill.

Name: Destiny
Description: Narrow Escape costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Fortune Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to change the face of one positive die in the character's dice pool to another face adjacent to it. An "adjacent" face is any die face sharing an edge—not a point—with the rolled face. Unmatched Fortune cannot be used on a [FO].

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Fortune can be used one additional time each game session per Frequency upgrade purchased.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Unmatched Fortune affects one additional die per Increase Number upgrade purchased.

Name: Shared Luck
Description: Unmatched Fortune can also be used on the dice pool of a willing ally within short range.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Fortune costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: Unmatched Fortune can also be used on negative dice.

Name: Increase Range
Description: Increases the maximum range at which Unmatched Fortune can affect willing allies by 1 per Increase Range upgrade purchased.

Name: Sudden Discovery Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Outer Rim) or Knowledge (Core Worlds) check[b]. If he succeeds, the character can pinpoint his exact location without a map or other guide, discover a lost or hidden item or location, or identify a safe and fast path through any terrain. The exact nature of what the character is trying to accomplish, as well as the end results, must be approved by the GM.

Name: Add Boost
Description: Add [BO] to skill check to activate Sudden Discovery.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from skill check to activate Sudden Discovery

Name: Change Skill
Description: Sudden Discovery can be activated with the Astrogation or Survival skills.

Name: Frequency
Description: Sudden Discovery may be used twice per game session.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Sudden Discovery to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Destiny
Description: Sudden Discovery costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Mobility Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to increase the number of maneuvers he is allowed to perform in a turn to three for the next true rounds. This third maneuver may be gained through any of the means a second maneuver is normally gained.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Mobility lasts for one additional round.

Name: Free Maneuver
Description: Gain one additional free maneuver while base ability is active. This does not increase per-turn maneuvers.

Name: Melee Defense
Description: Gain +1 melee defense while Unmatched Mobility is active.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Mobility costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Ranged Defense
Description: Gain +1 ranged defense while Unmatched Mobility is active.

Name: Activation
Description: May activate Diplomatic Solution at the start of any combat turn instead of only at the start of combat.

Name: Boost Allies
Description: Other friendly characters gain [BO] on social checks until the end of the encounter per Boost Allies Upgrade.

Name: Change Skill (Coercion)
Description: May make a Coercion check instead of a Charm check to activate Diplomatic Solution.

Name: Change Skill (Leadership)
Description: May make a Leadership check instead of a Charm check to activate Diplomatic Solution.

Name: Destiny
Description: Diplomatic Solution costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Diplomatic Solution Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, when a combat encounter against one or more sentient creatures is about to begin, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Charm check[b] to turn the encounter into a social encounter instead.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from skill check to activate Diplomatic Solution.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Insight costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Discern Motives
Description: The character realizes the motivations of each other participant in the scene.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Insight may be used twice per game session.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Increase the number of participants affected by 2 per Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Leverage
Description: Choose 1 character. Upgrade the ability of all social checks once per Leverage Upgrade against that character until the end of the encounter.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Diplomatic Solution to [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Secret
Description: Notice one important detail that a chosen character would prefer to conceal.

Name: Unmatched Insight Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, during an encounter or scene involving one or more other sentient creatures, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points. The character immediately becomes aware of the emotional states and basic histories of up to 3 chosen participants in the scene.

Name: Unmatched Survivability Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, when piloting a starship or vehicle with a silhouette of 3 or less that is crippled (has hull trauma in excess of its hull trauma threshold), the character may spend 2 Destiny Points as an incidental. The starship or vehicle operates as if it is not crippled for the next 3 rounds, acting as if its hull trauma is equal to its hull trauma threshold.

Name: Reinforcement
Description: The Critical rating of all weapons targeting the ship or vehicle counts as 1 higher while Unmatched Survivability is active.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Survivability costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Survivability lasts until the end of the encounter.

Name: Durability
Description: Reduce Critical Hits suffered by the ship or vehicle by 10 while Unmatched Survivability is active.

Name: Change Silhouette
Description: Unmatched Survivability affects ships or vehicles with 1 greater silhouette.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Survivability may be used twice per game session.

Name: This One is Mine Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, when piloting a starship or vehicle, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to challenge another starship or vehicle in the battle with equal silhouette. For 2 rounds, the two ships are locked in a duel. For the duration of the duel, the two dueling ships can only make attacks targeting each other, and no other starships or characters can target the dueling ships with attacks.

Name: Duration
Description: This One is Mine lasts for 1 additional round.

Name: Frequency
Description: This One is Mine may be used twice per game session.

Name: Change Silhouette
Description: This One is Mine can target ships or vehicle with a silhouette 1 higher or lower.

Name: Destiny
Description: This One is Mine costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Evasion
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of all incoming attacks once while This One is Mine is active.

Name: Unmatched Heroism Basic Ability
Description: [P]Once per game session, as an out of turn incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points. For the next 2 rounds, whenever an ally within short range is targeted by a successful combat check, the character may suffer 2 strain to move to engaged range of that ally and become the target of that combat check instead.

Name: Destiny
Description: [P]Unmatched Heroism costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Endurance
Description: [P]Reduce the strain cost to become the target of an attack with Unmatched Heroism by 1.

Name: Increase Range
Description: Increase the range at which Unmatched Heroism can affect allies to medium range.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Heroism lasts for 1 additional round.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Heroism may be used twice per game session.

Name: Cosmic Balance
Description: Whenever the character suffers a Critical Injury while Fated Duel is active, flip one Dark Side destiny point to a Light Side destiny point.

Name: Duration
Description: Fated Duel lasts for 1 additional round.

Name: Stand Firm
Description: Increase wound threshold by +4 while Fated Duel is active.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Fated Duel to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b]

Name: Fated Duel Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session, during a combat encounter, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check[b] to challenge another character. If he succeeds, the two characters are locked in a duel for 3 rounds. For the duration of the duel, the two dueling characters can only make attacks targeting each other and n other characters can target the dueling characters with attacks (or otherwise intervene).

Name: Inspiration
Description: Add [BO] to checks made by allies while Fated Duel is active.

Name: Optimization
Description: Upgrade one [AB] to be rerolled with Unmatched Calibration to [PR].

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Calibration costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Minimize Risk
Description: Downgrade one [CH] to be rerolled with Unmatched Calibration to [DI].

Name: Increase Number
Description: Unmatched Calibration affects one additional die per Increase Number upgraded purchased.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Calibration can be used one additional time each game session per Frequency upgrade purchased.

Name: Unmatched Calibration Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to reroll up to two dice in the character's dice pool. Unmatched Calibration cannot be used on a [FORCE].

Name: Remove Setback
Description: May remove [SE] instead of rerolling it.

Name: Destiny
Description: Inventive Creation costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Change Scale
Description: May create a vehicle of silhouette 2 or smaller using Inventive Creation.

Name: Increase Rarity
Description: Increase the rarity of the device the character can build by 1.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Inventive Creation to [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Inventive Creation Base Ability
Description: Oncer per game session, as an action, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b]. If he succeeds, the character immediately uses available parts to build a device that functions as an item of his choice with a rarity of 5 or lower. The item is functional until the end of the encounter, at which point it falls apart, shorts out, or otherwise ceases to function permanently. The exact nature of the device the character its trying to construct as well as the end results, must be apporved by the GM (see [B]Narrative Abilities[b] on page 38).

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from skill check to activate Inventive Creation

Name: Increase Effect: Reduce Difficulty
Description: May reduce the difficulty of an ally's skill check instead of downgrading the difficulty.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Authority costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Mass Combat
Description: The character can spend strain to modify Mass Combat  checks with Unmatched Authority as though it was an ally's skill check.

Name: Increase Effect: Remove Setback
Description: May remove [SE] from an ally's check instead of downgrading the difficulty.

Name: Firm Resolve
Description: Increase strain threshold by 2 while Unmatched Authority is active.

Name: Endurance
Description: Reduce the strain cost to modify an ally's skill check with Unmatched Authority by 1

Name: Unmatched Authority Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session, as an action during an encounter in structured time, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to gain the following ability for the remainder of the current round and two additional rounds. As an out of turn incidental, the character may suffer 2 strain to downgrade the difficulty of an ally's skill check once.

Name: Duration
Description:
Unmatched Authority lasts
one additional round.

Name: Turning Point
Description:
During a mass combat, may
activate Rousing Oratory to
create a turning point or
boost allies already taking
part in one.

Name: Destiny
Description:
Rousing Oratory costs 1
Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Recover Strain
Description:
Friendly characters and
NPCs targeted by Rousing
Oratory recover a number
of strain equal to the character’s
ranks in Leadership.

Name: Boost Allies
Description:
After triggering Rousing
Oratory, add [BO] per Boost
Allies upgrade to all Discipline
and Cool checks that
other friendly characters
and NPCs make until the
end of the encounter.

Name: Change Skill: Cool
Description:
May make a Cool check instead
of a Leadership check
to activate Rousing Oratory.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description:
Remove [SE] from skill check to
activate Rousing Oratory.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description:
Reduce the difficulty of the
skill check to activate
Rousing Oratory to [B]Average
([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Change Skill: Discipline
Description:
May make a Discipline check
instead of a Leadership check
to activate Rousing Oratory.

Name: Rousing Oratory Basic Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may perform a Rousing Oratory action, spend 2 Destiny Poins, and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Leadership check to inspire a group to take action in a military situation about which  members were previously hesitant.

Name: Shared Acumen
Description: Unmatched Calibration can also be used on the dice pool of a wiling ally within short range.

Name: Group Preparation
Description: All NPCs add [SE] to their combat checks targeting any PC who has not yet taken a turn in the current round.

Name: Unmatched Vigilance Base Ability
Description: Once per game session at the beginning of a structured encounter, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points. If he does so, he determines the Initiative order of the first round of the enounter. Characters still make checks to determine Initiative, but these results will only apply after Unmatched Vigilance's effects end.

Name: Group Vigilance
Description: All PCs add [BO] to their combat checks targeting any NPC who has already taken a turn during the current round..

Name: Always Alert
Description: After activating Unmatched Vigilance, the character may choose to use either Cool or Vigilance for his Initiative check.

Name: Duration
Description: The Initiative order the base ability establishes lasts 1 additional round per Duration upgrade purchased.

Name: Combat Preparation
Description: When the character activates Unmatched Vigilance he may choose to introduce a "fact" or additional context directly into the narrative as if he had spent a Destiny Point.

Name: Combat Readiness
Description: After activating Unmatched Vigilance, the character may immediately perform 1 free maneuver..

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate the Unmatched Vigilance base ability, the character only needs to spend 1 Destiny Point instead of the normal 2.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: The skill check difficulty to activate My City is [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] instead of [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Boost Skill: Skulduggery and Stealth
Description: When making a skill check while My City is active the character adds [BO] to Skulduggery and Stealth checks.

Name: Boost Skill: Streetwise and Survival
Description: When making a skill check while My City is active, the character adds [BO] to Streetwise and Survival checks.

Name: Downgrade
Description: While My City is active and the character is in the chosen city, he may suffer 2 strain to downgrade the difficulty of any Stealth check once.

Name: Change Skill: Streetwise
Description: When activating My City, the character may make a Streetwise check instead of a Knowledge (Core Worlds/Outer Rim) check.

Name: Change Skill: Underworld
Description: When activating My City, the character may make a Knowledge (Underworld) check instead of a Knowledge (Core Worlds/Outer Rim) check.

Name: Cover Upgrade
Description: While My City is active and the character is in the chosen city, whenever the character is in cover, he increases his ranged defense by 1.

Name: My City Base Ability
Description: Once per game session when in an urban setting, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Core Worlds)[b] or [B]Knowledge (Outer Rim) check[b]. If successful, for the remainder of the game session, the character may suffer 2 strain to recall or learn the location of any individual, group, or establishment within that city, and any relevant information.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate My City, the character only needs to spend 1 Destiny Point instead of the normal 2.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Pursuit can be activated twice per game session instead of once.

Name: Endurance
Description: Reduce the strain cost to keep up with the target by 1to a minimumof 0, per endurance upgrade.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Unmatched Pursuit, the character only needs to spend 1 Destiny Point, instead of the Nomral 2 Destiny Points.

Name: Increase Range
Description: Increase the maximum range at which a target can be increased to long range.

Name: Maneuver
Description: Should the target of Unmatched Pursuit spend a maneuver to increase the distance from the character, the character may immediately perform a Move maneuver as an out of turn incidental to close the distance between them.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Pursuit lasts for 1 additional round per Duration upgrade.

Name: The Bigger They Are... Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an action, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points, nominate one vehicle, starship, living creature of silhouette 2 or smaller that he can see and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Warfare) check[b]. If he succeeds, for the next 3 rounds,he and each other friendly character within medium range of him ignore the target's armor (or soak) when inflicting damage on the target with non-vehicle/starship weapons.

Name: Change Skill (Survival)
Description: May use Survival instead of Knowledge (Warfare) to acivate The Bigger They Are.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate The Bigger They Are to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Ongoing Salvo
Description: If the target is destroyed (or dies) while The Bigger They Are is active, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to select a new target for The Bigger They Are.

Name: Duration
Description: The Bigger They Are lasts for 2 additonal rounds.

Name: Change Skill (Athletics)
Description: May use Athletics instead of Knowledge (Warfare) to activate The Bigger They Are.

Name: Increase Silhouette
Description: Increase the silhouette of targets that can be affected by The Bigger They Are by 1.

Name: Destiny
Description: The Bigger They Are costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Pursuit Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, as n out of turn incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and designate one enemy character or vehicle within medium range (either personal or planetary scale) as the quarry for the next 3 rounds. If the designated target would successfully elude his pursuit, the character may voluntarily suffer 2 strain to keep pace preventing the target, from escaping him.

Name: Change Skill
Description: To acivate Unexpected Demise, the character can use Discipline.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: The skill check difficulty to activate Unexpected Demise is [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] instead of [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Unexpected Demise the character only needs to spend 1 Destiny Point instead of the normal 2 Destiny Points.

Name: Unexpected Demise Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an action, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] If successful, for the next 2 rounds the character may spend 1 maneuver to add 1 automatic [TR] to his next combat check made in that turn. In addition, for the next 2 rounds when the character inflicts a Critical Injury on a rival NPC, the target is immediately incapacitated in teh same way as a minion NPC would be (see page 400 of the [B]Force and Destiny[b] Core Rulebook).

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: When making a combat check with Unexpected Demise is active the character removes [SE].

Name: Duration
Description: Unexpected Demise lasts for 1 additional round per Duration upgrade.

Name: Takedown
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of the check once to begin with the mark in custody.

Name: Change Skill: Survival
Description: May activate Always Get My Mark with Survival instead of Streetwise.

Name: Change Skill: Underworld
Description: May activate Always Get My Mark with Knowledge (Underworld) instead of Streetwise.

Name: Improve Mobility
Description: Before performing a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, suffer 2 strain  to perform the Move maneuver as an incidental.

Name: Increase Effect: Nemesis
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of the check twice to find a nemesis NPC (or player character) instead of a minion.

Name: Unmatched Devistation Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, after performing a combat check, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to perform an additional combat check against the same target with the difficulty increased by 1 for each successful combat check the character has performed this turn. This combat check must be made using a non-starship vehicle weapon that the character has not already used this turn.

Name: Finish the Job
Description: While Unmatched Courage is active the character adds +2 damage for each Critical Injury he is suffering to the first hit of each successful combat check he makes.

Name: Increase Range
Description: If the character has a starship or access to interstellar travel, she may choose a character on a different planet to be her mark. If she does so, she travels to that mark's world.

Name: Too Tough To Die
Description: When Unmatched Courage ends, make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resillience check[b] to remove one Critical Injury.

Name: Unmatched Courage Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, as an out of turn incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to ignore the effects of all Critical Injuries for 2 rounds. When this effect ends, he fuggers the effects of these Critical Injuries as normal.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: While Unmatched Courage is active whenever the character would suffer strain, he may suffer that many wounds instead.

Name: Always Get My Mark Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may choose a known minion NPC on the same planet to be her mark, spend 2 Destiny Points, and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Streetwise check[b]. If she succeeds, the character tracks down the chosen mark; a new encounter begins as the character reaches the mark's location. The exact nature of the encounter, as well as the circumstances under which it takes place, must be approved by the GM (see [B]Narrative Abilites[b] on page 40).

Name: Increase Effect: Rival
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of the check once to find a rival NPC instead of a minion.

Name: Destiny
Description: Always Get My Mark costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: See It Through
Description: While Unmatched Courage is active, the character does not become incapacitated when his wounds exceed his wound threshold.

Name: Target Priority
Description: The character may choose a new legal target for each combat check made as part of Unmatched Devastation.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Perform additional combat checks equal to ranks in Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Always Get My Mark to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Courage lasts for 2 additional rounds.

Name: Draw and Fire
Description: Before performing each combat check with Unmatched Devastation, the character may holster and draw a weapon.

Name: Remove Setback
Description: When making a combat check part of Unmatched Devastation, remove [SE] equal to ranks in Remove Setback upgrade.

Name: Survivor
Description: While Unmatched Courage is active, add [BO] to checks to remove Critical Injuries.

Name: Unmatched Devastation Base Ability
Description:
Once per game session, after performing a combat check, the character may spend 2 Destiny POints to perform one additional combat check against the same target as an incidental.
[P]
The difficulty of this combat check is increased by 1 for each successful combat check the character has performed this turn. This combat check must be made using a non-starship/vehicle weapon that the character has not already used this turn.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Perform addition combat checks equal to ranks in Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Draw and Fire
Description: Before performing each combat check with Unmatched Devastation, the character may holster and draw a weapon.

Name: Target Priority
Description: The character may choose a new legal target for each combat check made as part of Unmatched Devastation.

Name: Remove Setback
Description: When making a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, remove [SE] equal to ranks in Remove Setback upgrade.

Name: Improve Mobility
Description: Before performing a combat check as part of Unmatched Devastation, suffer 2 strain to perform the move maneuver as an incidental.

Name: Add Triumph
Description: Whenever the character fails a Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation check while this power is active, the character adds automatic [TR] to the results.

Name: Remove Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from any checks affected by Unmatched Negotiation.

Name: Duration
Description: Unmatched Negotiation lasts for 1 additional round.

Name: Increase Range
Description: Increase the range at which this ability affects allied PCs to medium range.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: Engaged allied characters making Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation checks while this power is active downgrade their difficulty once.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Negotiation costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Unmatched Negotiation Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Point. For the rest of the round, whenever that character makes a Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation check, the character downgrades the difficulty of the check the number of times needed to remove all [CH] from the pool.

Name: Much to Learn Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI] [DI] [DI]) Knowledge (Education) check[b], then choose one talent that the character possesses. For the remainder of the current encounter, one character within medium range counts as having that talent. If that talent is ranked, the allied character counts as having as may ranks in the talent as the character with this signature ability does.

Name: Improve Talent
Description: If the character possesses the improved version of the chosen talent, allies affected count as possessing it too for the duration of the encounter.

Name: Change Skill: Leadership
Description: May make a Leadership check, instead of a Knowledge (Education) check to activate Much to Learn.

Name: Change Skill: Knowledge
Description: May make any Knowledge skill check instead of a Knowledge (Education) check to activate Much to Learn.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Much to learn to [B]Average ([DI] [DI])[b].

Name: Destiny
Description: Much to Learn costs 1 Destiny Point instead of 2.

Name: Supreme Talent
Description: If the character possesses the supreme version of the chosen talent, allies affected count as possessing it too for the duration of the encounter.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Increase the number of allies affected by 2 per Increase Number upgrade.

Name: The Harder They Fall Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b]. If successful, for the remainder of the encounter, combat checks the character makes against vehicles, structures, or droids that inflict wounds or hull trauma automatically inflict a Critical lnjury or Critical Hit (depending on the target). [AD] or [TR] can be spent to trigger the attack's critical rating additional times, adding + 10 to the critical roll as usual.

Name: Increase Number
Description: The effects of The Harder They Fall extend to a number of allies within medium range equal to ranks in Increase Number.

Name: Change Skill
Description: The skill check to activate The Harder They Fall can be made using Knowledge (Education) or Knowledge (Warfare) instead of the Mechanics skill.

Name: Ignore Defenses
Description: While The Harder They Fall is active, combat checks that the character makes ignore one point of defense rating per Ignore Defenses.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate The Harder They Fall, the character needs to spend one Destiny Point instead of the normal two Destiny Points.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: The difficulty of the skill check to activate The Harder They Fall is [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] instead of [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Frequency
Description: The Harder They Fall can be used one additional time per game session.

Name: Unmatched Ingenuity Base Ability
Description: Once per game session as an action, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b]. If successful, he can add one item quality (except Breach or Concussive) to a weapon or item he is holding or operating. If applicable, the item quality has a rating of 1. The character may spend [TR] to add one additional quality to the same item, and [AD] to increase an item quality's rating by 1 . This alteration lasts for 2 rounds, or ten minutes of narrative time.

Name: Add Boost
Description: When making the skill check to activate Unmatched Ingenuity, the character adds [BO] per Add Boost upgrade.

Name: Duration
Description: The alteration from using Unmatched Ingenuity lasts for 1 additional round per Duration Upgrade.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Unmatched Ingenuity, the character needs to spend only 1 Destiny Point instead of the normal 2 Destiny Points.

Name: Quality: Breach
Description: The character may also apply the Breach item quality to the weapon or item.

Name: Quality: Concussive
Description: The character may also apply the Concussive item quality to the weapon or item.

Name: Reduced Difficulty
Description: The difficulty of the skill check to activate Unmatched Ingenuity is [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] instead of [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b].

Name: Prophecy Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point and make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to utter a prophecy. If they succeed, they foretell a single event, the focus of which is centered around themself. At any time before the end of the game session. they may spend 1 Destiny Point, at which point the foretold event transpires. The GM should interpret the prophecy to fit the scene, possibly revealing truths the character did not foresee in the process.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from the check to activate Prophecy.

Name: Flow of the Universe
Description: Add [BO] to the character's checks to bring the foretold event to fruition.

Name: Shared Revelation
Description: The prophecy may pertain to any one other character who hears it.

Name: Recurrence
Description: One additional time before the end of the game session, the character may spend 1 Destiny Point to have to prophecy's foretold event recur, likely in a different form.

Name: Reduce Difficulty
Description: Reduce the difficulty of the skill check to activate Prophecy to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Name: Doom
Description: Add [SE] to any character's checks to prevent the foretold event from occurring.

Name: Destiny
Description: Prophecy costs 1 fewer Destiny Points to activate, it still requires a Destiny Point to trigger the occurrence of the prophesised event.

Name: Unmatched Destiny Base Ability
Description: Once per game session, after making a Force power check, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to reroll up to 2 Force dice. Conflict generated as part of this Force power check is doubled.

Name: Increase Number
Description: Reroll up to 1 additional Force die per Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Destiny costs 1 fewer Destiny Points to activate.

Name: Shared Destiny
Description: Unmatched Destiny can be used after another character at short range makes a Force power check.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Destiny can be used 1 additional time per session.

Name: Unleashed Power
Description:
For each [LI][LI] result, add automatic [LI] to the check.
[P]For each [DA][DA] result, add automatic [DA] to the check.

Name: Deadly Reputation Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to activate Deadly Reputation. Until the end of the character's next turn, increase the difficulty of all skill checks targeting the character by one.

Name: Duration
Description: Deadly Reputation lasts for one additional turn.

Name: Deadly by Association
Description: Deadly Reputation also affect checks targeting the character's allies.

Name: Add Setback
Description: Add [SE] to checks affected by Deadly Reputation.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of checks affected by Deadly Reputation.

Name: Destiny
Description: Deadly Reputation costs 1 fewer Destiny Point to activate.

Name: Unmatched Ferocity Base Ability
Description: Once per session after resolving a successful Melee combat check against a target engaged with the character, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points. The character then suffers 4 strain and 1 Conflict to immediately make a Melee attack as an incidental against the same target, increasing the difficulty of tile check by one, to a maximum difficulty of [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI])[b]. If successful, the character may repeat the process (suffering further strain and Conflict).

Name: Reduce Strain
Description: Reduce the strain suffered to make additional attacks by 1.

Name: Change Skill (Brawl)
Description: The character may activate Unmatched Ferocity after a successful Brawl check.

Name: Change Skill (Lightsaber)
Description: The character may activate Unmatched Ferocity after a successful Lightsaber check.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Ferocity costs 1 fewer Destiny Point to activate.

Name: Change Target
Description: The character may choose a different target for each attack made as a result of Unmatched Ferocity.

Name: Reduce Conflict
Description: The character may choose to suffer an additional 2 strain instead of 1 Conflict to activate Unmatched Ferocity.

Name: Counterespionage Base Ability
Description: Once per game session the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to make an [B]opposed Knowledge (Warfare) vs. Deception check[b] against an identified enemy agent or espionage leader. If successful, the character utterly foils one previously identified ploy or tactic associated with that enemy’s act of espionage. The exact nature of how the character accomplishes this must be approved by the GM, but should be suitably cunning and clever. Note that the enemy character does not need to be physically present or near the character for this ability to be used, and that the GM has final say on which NPCs are valid targets.

Name: Add Boost
Description: When making the skill check to activate Counterespionage, the character adds [BO] per Add Boost upgrade.

Name: Change Skill (Charm)
Description: The skill check the character makes as part of using Counterespionage can be made using Charm instead of Knowledge (Warfare).

Name: Change Skill (Negotiation)
Description: The skill check the character makes as part of using Counterespionage can be made using Negotiation instead of Knowledge (Warfare).

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from the character’s skill check as part of using Counterespionage.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Counterespionage, the character needs to spend only one Destiny Point instead of the normal two Destiny Points.

Name: Turn Agent
Description: Spend [TR] on a successful check to activate Counterespionage to turn one identified enemy agent into a double agent secretly working for the character.

Name: Unmatched Tradecraft Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an incidental, after the player rolls the dice for a Deception check but before resolving the results, he may spend 2 Destiny Points to remove one the rolled [DI] from the pool. The results from the [DI] are ignored, and the check is then resolved as normal.

Name: Increase Effect (Setback)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may also be used on [SE].

Name: Increase Effect (Challenge)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may also be used on [CH].

Name: Increase Number
Description: The number of dice removed through Unmatched Tradecraft increases by one per Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Change Skill (Stealth)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may be used with the Stealth skill instead of Deception.

Name: Change Skill (Skulduggery)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may be used with the Skulduggery skill instead of Deception.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Unmatched Tradecraft, the character needs to spend only one Destiny Point instead of the normal two Destiny Points.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft can be used an additional time per game session.

Name: Add Setback
Description: Add [SE] to checks affected by Deadly Reputation.

Name: Change Skill - Brawl
Description: The character may activate Unmatched Ferocity after a successful Brawl check.

Name: Change Skill - Lightsaber
Description: The character may activate Unmatched Ferocity after a successful Lightsaber check.

Name: Change Target
Description: The character may choose a different target for each attack made as a result of Unmatched Ferocity.

Name: Deadly By Association
Description: Deadly Reputation also affect checks targeting the character's allies.

Name: Deadly Reputation Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to activate Deadly Reputation. Until the end of the character's next turn, increase the difficulty of all skill checks targeting the character by one.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Ferocity costs 1 fewer Destiny Point to activate.

Name: Destiny
Description: Deadly Reputation costs 1 fewer Destiny Point to activate.

Name: Increase Duration
Description: Deadly Reputation lasts for one additional turn.

Name: Increase Effect
Description: Upgrade the difficulty of checks affected by Deadly Reputation.

Name: Reduce Conflict
Description: The character may choose to suffer an additional 2 strain instead of 1 Conflict to activate Unmatched Ferocity.

Name: Reduce Strain
Description: Reduce the strain suffered to make additional attacks by 1.

Name: Unmatched Ferocity Base Ability
Description: Once per session after resolving a successful Melee combat check against a target engaged with the character, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points. The character then suffers 4 strain and 1 Conflict to immediately make a Melee attack as an incidental against the same target, increasing the difficulty of tile check by one, to a maximum difficulty of [B]Formidable ([DI][DI][DI][DI][DI])[b]. If successful, the character may repeat the process (suffering further strain and Conflict).

Name: Add Boost
Description: When making the skill check to activate Counterespionage, the character adds [BO] per Add Boost upgrade.

Name: Change Skill (Charm)
Description: The skill check the character makes as part of using Counterespionage can be made using Charm instead of Knowledge (Warfare).

Name: Change Skill (Negotiation)
Description: The skill check the character makes as part of using Counterespionage can be made using Negotiation instead of Knowledge (Warfare).

Name: Change Skill (Skulduggery)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may be used with the Skulduggery skill instead of Deception.

Name: Change Skill (Stealth)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may be used with the Stealth skill instead of Deception.

Name: Counterespionage Base Ability
Description: Once per game session the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to make an [B]opposed Knowledge (Warfare) vs. Deception check[b] against an identified enemy agent or espionage leader. If successful, the character utterly foils one previously identified ploy or tactic associated with that enemy’s act of espionage. The exact nature of how the character accomplishes this must be approved by the GM, but should be suitably cunning and clever. Note that the enemy character does not need to be physically present or near the character for this ability to be used, and that the GM has final say on which NPCs are valid targets.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Unmatched Tradecraft, the character needs to spend only one Destiny Point instead of the normal two Destiny Points.

Name: Destiny
Description: To activate Counterespionage, the character needs to spend only one Destiny Point instead of the normal two Destiny Points.

Name: Frequency
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft can be used an additional time per game session.

Name: Increase Effect (Challenge)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may also be used on [CH].

Name: Increase Effect (Setback)
Description: Unmatched Tradecraft may also be used on [SE].

Name: Increase Number
Description: The number of dice removed through Unmatched Tradecraft increases by one per Increase Number upgrade.

Name: Reduce Setback
Description: Remove [SE] from the character’s skill check as part of using Counterespionage.

Name: Turn Agent
Description: Spend [TR] on a successful check to activate Counterespionage to turn one identified enemy agent into a double agent secretly working for the character.

Name: Unmatched Tradecraft Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an incidental, after the player rolls the dice for a Deception check but before resolving the results, he may spend 2 Destiny Points to remove one the rolled [DI] from the pool. The results from the [DI] are ignored, and the check is then resolved as normal.

Name: Unmatched Teamwork Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an icidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Points to activate Unmatched Teamwork. Until the end of the encounter, the character may assist another character as an incidental (instead of a maneuver) once per round.

Name: Increase Effect:  Success
Description: The character's assistance instead adds [SU]

Name: Increase Effect:  Success and Advantage
Description: The character's assistance instead adds [SU] [AD]

Name: Increase Effect:  Triumph
Description: The character's assistance instead adds [TR]

Name: Remove Setback
Description: The character's assistance also removes [SE]

Name: Increase Range
Description: Increase the range at which the character can provide assistance by one range band.

Name: Camaraderie
Description: When the character provides assistance, they heal 2 strain from themself.

Name: Destiny
Description: Unmatched Teamwork costs 1 fewer Destiny point to activate.

Name: Peerless Interception Base Ability
Description: Once per session as an out-of-turn incidental, the character may spend 2 Destiny Po1nlS to activate Peerless interception. For the next two rounds, when the character uses Parry or Reflect to reduce the damage of a hit, they reduce the damage by an add1t1ona1 amount equal to their Force rating.

Name: Destiny
Description: Peerless Interception costs 1 fewer Destiny Point to activate

Name: Increase Duration
Description: Peerless Interception lasts for one additional round.

Name: Critical Counter
Description: When the character spends [DE] to inflict a hit on their attacker using Improved Parry or Improved Reflect, they also inflict a Critical Injury.

Name: Reduce Strain
Description: The character only suffers strain the first time they use Parry or Reflect each round.

Name: Activate Quality
Description: When the character uses Improved Parry or Improved Reflect to inflict a hit on an attacker, they may activate one item quality.

Name: Effortless Counter
Description: Once per round, character may use Improved Parry or Improved Reflect to inflict a hit on their attacker without spending [TH] or [DE].

Name: Increase Frequency
Description: The character may activate Peerless Interception one additional time per session.
